intro: Pilea mutisiana, commonly known as the Mexican mint plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Pilea mutisiana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
